content.description: short, but a good warmup for LFC; - sit start with a good left hand jug, low right hand compression sloper and feet smears - move your hands up into the good seams, eventually throwing right hand up to the amazing pinch jug. Get high feet, lockoff on that pinch, and balance your way up to a shallow seam. Easy top out after braving the less-than-decent fall potential.
content.protection: pads and a spotter...or you could have no pads, no spotter, and no shoes like the first ascent...
content.location: Arete left of Little Fluffy Clouds

content.description: A classic atypical Haycock line following a featured overhanging arete before pulling onto the face and the topout. Sit start utilizing an under cling with feet smearing on the face, climb the jugs and pinches with big moves and turn the lip with a small feet cut move before slapping up for the lip.
content.protection: 3-4 pads, the landing follows the angle of the arete so at any time you are not more than 4 feet off the ground.
content.location: From the clearing between Hanger 18 and Area 51 follow the right fork in the trail towards the Bokow boulder, from here continue down towards the cave trail and break right after about 100 yards, the boulders should be on your right.

content.description:
A few different options exist to crimp and slap your way up this one.  

  SDS on the jug at the base of the arete. Using crimps and a sloper, make you way up to another jug about 3/4 of the way up the arete. An easier top out awaits.
content.location: Follow the Caves Trail. If coming from the Hanger 18 side, this boulder is not too far from Little Fluffy Clouds. Just be sure to stay on trail and you'll walk right past this one. If coming from the opposite side of the mountain, continue a little further past the Dubeck boulder. Again, as long as you stay on trail (which can be hard to do), you'll run right across the front of this boulder.
